description: mounted on heavy paper with grey and black borders; green overmat; profile of man from PL side; man is balding, with stray tufts of hair on front of head, thin scraggly beard and moustache, and long eyebrow hairs; man has closed eyes and open mouth; wearing red shirt and grey cloak
medium: Black and red chalk on laid paper
provenance: [Richard Day, London, until 1983; sold July 8 for $1,117.73 to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1983-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: A Grosteque Male Head
